values: Needs to post more often. I kinda suck at keeping this journal up.

alas! i am back in the USA, and i hate it. i miss the cruise a lot. it was so much fun. and i met a guy. yeah, for meeting guys. this time he is from romania, and i will never see him again. *sobs a little* ugh...now i don't feel like talking about him. maybe i'll be up to it tomorrow.

Ok, so today was senior emo day, and I have got to say that my outfit rocked. See, it actually looked like I pulled my outfit out of a scene kid's closet, not a goth's (which of course half of my grade doesn't know the difference between the two. Yeah some of them were wearing very goth like clothes, and what was worse was the fact that they could tell the difference between death metal, punk rock, alternative and emo music. Seriously. And of course all of the music they played was very main stream. Look, if you are going to make fun of the stereotype, then at least bring up some underground music). Plus, somehow I am amazingly good at acting depressed. I was seriously asked at least 10 times whether or not I was "feeling ok." Some people even said that my sadness was making them depressed. I love that feeling. Today in general was great.

So, I am taking this robotics class in school, and so far we haven't done that much with robots. Our teacher said that as soon as we got into a contest we would start building the robot. Well, after almost a month we have successfully entered a contest. I am so excited and I am downloading the software right now. Sorry this is a weird rant, but I am excited.

So this weekend I went to Mo Ranch, and I have to say that I had a decent time. I got to hang out with my really good guy friends and then have girl talk with some of the juniors, sam and ali. I can even say that the Mo-Down was fun. However, and that is an extremely emphasized however, the night of senior pranks/sneak-out was terrible.

First let me tell you that the supposed "sneak-out" wasn't even a real sneak-out. Every single chaperon knew when we were going to do it at 1 am, and even encouraged it. I know- weird! Whatever.

So then we decided that we needed to intimidate the freshmen and sophomores. We went into the freshman dorm quietly and on the count of three we started to scream "Get on the damn floor, fish" and flicker the lights. Half of them looked at us with unsure or upset faces, and the others scrambled to lie face down on the floor. I can admit that the scared freshmen made me quiet happy inside, but it was those that stood up and acted against us that troubled me. They yelled at us to "get the fuck out!" At that time the seniors felt it was time to go, before it really got ugly. But as we were leaving a girl came up to one of us and asked in a truly condescending voice "Are you done yet?!" So later the girls went back into there room and turn the air up to 99 degrees. I know that it was mean, but come on they were being hazed. They should have shown us more respect. We didn't actually hurt any of them, we just woke them up. Then we moved to the sophomores, who were a little more compliant so we left them alone after the initial hazing. (We also woke up the Junior guys, but it was crappily done)

Of course it was time to spell out the senior slogan, on the grass that is below the tall cat-walk (in case you don't know there is a tall cat-walk that goes across the camp, and below the cat walk is a large field of grass, where many leave messages that are formed by the placement of rocks in the shape of letter). To begin with we had a huge argument about what the rocks should say. Some said "08, don't hate", others "08, master8" (that is because we couldn't say masturbate), and still others said "08, party late". In the end, we ended up with "08, party late" (I wanted master8, but that was only because of the irony of being at a church based camp ground). So we went down below the cat-walk and began to argue once more on how to actually start the damn thing. Finally, a handful of people just decided to screw the rest of the group and start working (I was among that group). And it ended up that only that handful of people (it was only 10 of 30 or 40 seniors that worked. four of which were above us on the cat walk directing us were to put rocks, and the other six, including me, pulling out the tall grass and finding large rocks) actually completed the slogan, the rest of the people just stood around and bitched about stuff that was being done. Seriously the people that worked were the least bitchy, and we were doing the manual labor. I guess you can say that we worked well as a team. The rest of them just snipped at us, but we ignored ever word. Our logic was that if they were to actually do some manual labor, then they could have a say on how the words should be formed. In the end, we got fed up with the seniors that did nothing and basically said "Fuck you!"

We finally finished at 3 o clock, with the all the labors having the sweaty and dirty bodies as proof of their work. Then, the girls that had been bitching at us for the past hour and a half, decided that we needed to have a "group hug." God, I think that every single one of the labors just wanted to get the hell out of there. So we went up to the cat-walk to admire our work, which I got to say was freaking awesome. But as I was walking up there I heard one of the bitchy slackers say "Oh my god, we did so much work." My blood boiled, and I seriously considered strangling that girl on the spot. I really don't think that those people deserved the credit, it should have only belonged to the 10 of us.

I finally decided to go to bed at 4 am after a well deserved shower. And got up drearily at 11 am, to get onto the bus where I fell back asleep on Aaron's (no, not Oni's) shoulder until we got back home.

I feel really sorry for you if you read my rant of doom. Seriously this was just a rant, a excessively angry rant, but a rant none the less. Maybe in a few day's I'll be over myself, but for now I am going to stay very angry (and possibly rant some more).
I survived! We have also pulled 2 senior pranks. SENIORS '08!!!

Is it pathetic that I have already been diagnosed the fatal aliment of seniorites. Seriously, I have been back in school for one day, and already I feel a need to get the hell out of there. Fortunately for me, all I was required to do was sign a bunch of papers and pretend to listen. Ah...what a way to start senior year.

Hey, I thought that I just got out of this eternal hell pit called school. I don't want to go back into the flame furnace of knowledge. I want to be an utter slacker, and mosey about all day. Seriously, who signed my up for this 12 year commitment, for they will suffer my foreboding wrath. 
    Oh wait, I  just  remember that  it was I who decided to enter grade school. It was I who wanted to learn my alphabet and how to count. Why did I bring such misery upon myself. Oh bother. Well, I might as well bring down that "foreboding wrath" upon myself then. Bring on the self loathing!
Ugh...I started college apps today. It sucks so much. I want to kill myself.

Finally this week is over. I was about to die, because it was taking to long. Government is easy, but boring. I had a guy insult me because of my race, which in a word sucked. Nonetheless, I am over it, and just want to sleep now. O by the way there is a guy with a hot British accent in my class. *smiles*
haha, I just finished my last SAT. WOOH!! No more SAT!!!

Well, thanks to my short attention span, I completely forgot to mention one slight detail that my choir director gave us at the end of the year party. WE ARE GOING TO CARNEGIE HALL NEXT YEAR AND PERFORMING JOHN RUTTER'S GLORIA!!!! I AM STILL QUAKING WITH JOY!!!

So it looks like sam is still talking to me. I recently got an account on facebook and I accidentally added him as a friend (cause he was in my address book from yahoo). And he seemed fine when I did, so whatever. 

Anywho, so I have realized that I don't enjoy watching the same shows as all of the kids my age. Shows like the OC, my super sweet sixteen, the real world, grey's anatomy, and lost just don't appeal to me. This I can understand, because I find that these shows are a waste of my time. But the weirdest thing about this sudden realization isn't about the shows that I hate, but in fact it is about the shows that I like. I have tendencies to watch old people shows. Things like the wheel of fortune, the price is right, and jeopardy. I truly do not understand myself.
Didn't do much today. Basically I got up at 1 and waited the rest of the day until the star wars documentary came on. Kinda sad.

So recently I read this short story in Spanish class, and to be honest with you it was one of the weirdest things that I have ever read. It wasn't trippy or anything, it was just extremely boring. The story was called <u>El cuentecillo triste</u>, and I was about how this guy got bored on Sundays (really this is no joke). So the guy puts out an add to the newspaper for a girl to date. He even put the fact that he got bored on Sundays in the newspaper article. Then about a week later a girl replied to the article and the two went out on date, and to be truthful by the end of the story the two had fallen asleep in the movie theater because they got bored. 

     Then today I realized something, I am exactly like the guy. I have nothing to do and I am so freaking bored. Actually, I am bored out of my mind. I have not done a single thing that is productive this past weekend. I am almost mad at myself for being so lazy. *continuously smacks forehead* I...Must...Remember...That...Sloth...Is...BAD!!! UUUUG! o well, off to find something to do

I can't believe it, school is almost over. And you know what that means? I am now a senior. FINALLY. I have waited my entire freaking life for this day to come. However, the weird thing is that now that it is here I am not as happy/excited as I thought I would be. Hmm...that seems strange to me. O well, at least summer is here.
HAHA! I am one AP down, and I have two to go. The fortunate thing is that the next two APs are not nearly as hard as todays. O well.

So in these recent days I have been growing jealous of all those who can write spectacularly. I have know earthly idea why. I guess it could be because I am not able whip a perfect sentence out of my ass each time I need one. Where as my friend, Susan, just has this perfectly elegant flow to every paper she writes. Oh well, I know my stuff is complete crap, so it doesn't matter.

So I know I have been gone for who knows how long, but I'm back and ready for action. Anyways I should delve into ranting about my spring break trip. I left last week to florida. Okay at this point most people would say hey your lucky, you got to get away from your home and enjoy the sun. Then of course I would say yes I am indeed lucky, but there is some unfortunate things that happened on the trip. Of course my parents being the weird procrastinators that they are decided that we should not stay in orlando or tampa,  but instead they chose a random sleepy town of ruskin to place our sorry little butts in. Also my brothers, who are whiny and quite annoying, decided that instead of doing something fun like I don't know going to universal studios or disney world we should go to spring training. Oh and I forgot to mention that the rental car we got was a town car, which means it had limited space. So lucky me I got to be squashed in between my two brothers everytime we went anywhere (and when I say anywhere I mean places that were at 2-3 hours away from ruskin). Luckily my parents decided against going to cape canveral, otherwise I would have been stuck in a car for 6 hours (and that is just going to the cape, then we would have to travel 6 hours back). Well at least I am home now. But this is why I hate family trips.

O yes, it has totally snowed, IN TEXAS. O crap this must be a sign of the apocolypse *checks bible*. Well, maybe not, but still this never happens. And tomorrow there is supposed to be an inch of snow (to all those that live in the north, shut up, I can't help that I have never seen snow before. And I can't help the fact that an inch of snow makes me happy). Also I have had a five day weekend which is AWESOME! so signing off

So basically, my life is fine. I got a speaking part as a munchkin which totally rocks (it is a one liner, but I was the only person that tried out for the part so I got it). I have had a good 3 day going on four day weekend (thank the heavens for snow days). But you know how I said that I had finally gotten over Sam, well, I guess my lovely unconcious mind hasn't, because all I have been dreaming about lately is Sam. It doesn't make much sense, and the weird thing is everytime I wake up I get all depressed. I guess I am not completely over him, but I really wish I was.

So I know that I haven't been able to get on to this website in a while, but nothing of importance has happened. Just school. Well, I guess I can officially say that I am over Sam. Thank goodness. I felt like I would never get over him. However, there are plenty of fish in the sea, and I definitely can't wait until one of them likes me. Oh, I just remembered I made a munchkin in the wizard of oz. It has been my dream to be a munchkin, because I fit so well into the part (although these are small roles, I have always liked the munchkins. They make me smile). Actually I got to see call backs for most of the cast and I liked all of those who are the leading roles. My friend Marianne, who tried out for the witch, went up against a junior who was quite good, but in the end she lacked in facial expression for a witch (what I mean is her face was still too cute looking for a evil witch) and Marianne got the part. It was amazing.
hehe this is an awesome song

YEAH!!! I get to go to the Full Metal Alchemist movie tomorrow. It is the only time it is showing in my town in a theater and I get to go see it. WOOT. I am so dressing up to school tomorrow in a ed costume. OMG I AM EXCITED. (look i know the date on the poster is different than tomorrows date, but that just shows that america needs to bring anime faster, plus my town sucks cause it is only showing it once)
I get to go to six flags tommorrow!!! Yes. I have been waiting for this all week. Now i can go see Doug. Yeah, Doug!! He is so awesome. I am so gonna enjoy tommorrow

I can't believe it but i have actually almost made it through the first two weeks of the six weeks. No my junior year is already slipping away. Goodness, now I have to pick out a college. Speaking of colleges, this past weekend Rice was up at the hilton on sunday, and of course I went. It was interesting and (this is the weird part) I feel compelled, not by someone else but myself to apply there next year. Most colleges, especially colleges in TX I don't want to go to, because I have certain colleges that I want to go to. But on Sunday I suddenly had the urge to go and ask more. I don't know, but I think I should give the college a chance. OOOOOO...I totally forgot. I GOT TICKETS TO THE FULLMETAL ALCHEMIST MOVIE!!!! MUHAHAHA!!!!! And I am getting a Rose dress. Eep it is so awesome!
WHAAAA!!! I DON'T WANT TO START SCHOOL. YOU CAN'T MAKE ME. *my parental units start dragging me into school as I scratch the ground to get away* YOU WILL TORTURE ME. PLEASE, DON'T.

Well, if I could explain that trip in one word it was horrible. I knew that we shouldn't have taken that trip. Ok let me explain. We started our lovely drive to corpus cristi early in the morn. Every one was all grumpy, cause none of us are morning people. Especially my dad. My dad was in one of his moods, where if you say anything negative (i mean anything. like "this hotdog tastes bad") he will blow up and not talk to the negative speaking person for about a week. Normally he will only do it to the kids (aka me, and my two bros). But lately when he is a mood he has been taking it out on mom. In fact they have been getting into so many fights lately, but normally he will talk to her a few hours later. Now let us venture into the past to a time when I had no livejournal to vent to. This was a few months ago and one of the main reasons that I got this account to begin with. 
I think it was april or march, but anyway one day my dad's fit of fury went further than ever before. I don't know what happened that day that made him so mad, but he was mad. I believe that my mom brought up some bad news to him (not saying that it was mildly bad news because it was very bad news), but apparently what happen is that when she said the news, my dad exploded (i wasn't there to witness it). My  dad  said that he was going to leave my mom, and as soon as he said that he took off in his car (don't know where he went and to this day I still don't).  My mom came into my room crying  bawling (i had never seen my mom cry, she is a very stoic person, and thus shows little emotion). She told me that my dad had taken off. That night I screamed into my pillow until I fell asleep.  He eventually came back. Now back to the lovely future.  As I said in the beginning my dad has these moods, and on the trip over my mom noticed. He shrugged it off saying it was nothing. Yet , later on in the trip, apparently their attorney called about who in hell knows what, and he talked to my mom. When my mom told my dad what the phone call was about  he apparently got really irritated. Later they were resting in the hotel, my mom said that my dad broke into another argument.  This time it was fierce, and my dad literally got up and walked out of the room.  I didn't know what was going on cause I was in the other room reading a book while my bros were playing a game. But my mom came into the room, and said that he had left. She also said that we were to go back the next day, and that as soon as we were back my dad was going to go find an apartment. For the day all I could think about is their divorce. It was the worst feeling ever. And I know that I shouldn't hate my dad, but I don't  know if I could forgive him. This time he made my brother cry (he like my mom show little emotion, in fact he shows none at all) along with my  other brother (who cried the first time) and my mom.  I didn't cry, until now as I am typing it all, but that is besides the point, because all I could do was hate. Look, I am not saying that my situation is as bad as it gets(cause it's not), but still I am very hurt.

look I am not a lindsey lohan fan, in fact she is one of my least favorite singers ever, but when i heard this song (a day after the incident this weekend) i almost cried
http://www.youtube.com/v/0YPeGsxkbkY
I am leaving for my trip. See you on Sunday.
ugh i have to go to corpus this weekend with my parents. i can just see the boredom now. I am ecstatic

Right, so last week I went to Rockyvine. It's a retreat that my church has gone to for the past year.  It is in Dutzow, Missouri (who thought of that name). Anyways alot happened, so much that I am not sure that I could type it all out. And it is not that anything that happened wasn't important, cause I certainly believe that they entire trip was important to me. But there will be this one part of the trip that sticks out to me the most. I was in mass and the priest was saying the homily. During our homily he decides to sing us a song rather than talk (cause he is just that cool). The Song is called Find Your Wings by Mark Harris. (This is the part where every thing gets confusing, so bare with me) In the middle of the song I started crying (they were silent teardrops). I don't know why, but I did (believe me I still don't know why, and I have listened to the song over a hundred times since I got home). So, mass went on, and my friends didn't notice. I stopped crying, and it was all good until the end of mass. I decided to stay in the church rather than go to lunch right away, to ask God why I was crying. As soon as I sat back down on the pew, I began to cry again. This time it was the wailish cry with all the extras that come along when you are crying. The priest had to come up to me twice just to make sure that I was okay. But in the middle of my cry fest, it just felt as if the hands of God were on my shoulders , because I felt this instant peace. It was a peace that I hadn't felt in a long time. (believe I haven't , it is because of the this lack of peace that I started this journal) All that has happened over the years, especially this year, was just washed away. I instantly got up, and left the church. I came upon the lunch hall, with my face still full of tears, and Chris S. walked out. He saw my face and he instantly pulled me into a hug. Of course, he had to inquire about what was going on. And I told that I had just spent the last twenty minutes in the church crying. All he did was cradle me and stroke my hair, telling me that it was okay. Okay so the video is not the real music video, but  I could not find the real one (dude I would have prefered it over Naruto). Just listen to the song.
http://www.youtube.com/v/GDtSTr7Clkk

You've been totally Bzoink*d

Ok, so I just got back from a conference in Missouri. At 2:30 am. That was exciting, Not. Well, the retreat was allmax, but the trip from St. Louis to here was way to long.  I really enjoyed the retreat, it gave me alot of God time. I learned somethings about myself, and I am glad I did. Otherwise I would be in this constant mode of sadness. Anyway the retreat itself (worship, adoration and mass) is way to hard to explain in words. All I can say is that my God was present.

Ok, so today is fourth of july. HAPPY B-DAY AMERICA. Nothing special has happen. I spent the entire day sitting in my room doing my homework. Yeah, NOT. So, I finally managed to strike up the courage to email Sam. Now all I have to do is wait for an answer, if I get one. I hope I don't regret what I have just done. I hate being so old fashioned. Most of my friends would have already gone for him at least 3 1/2 years ago. Yet, I was bearly able to email him today. The good thing is, he probably won't read the email until way into the year (he has crappy internet). What scared me the most was actually copying the original letter into the email. I don't know why, but my heart felt like it was going a hundred miles per second. I'm scared.

I know that I have been doing this for a long time, but I still hate waking in the morning. I hating working on Saturday mornings. I know I shouldn't complain cause I at least have a job, but I love sleeping and dreaming. I especially like dreaming. Anyway, so today is my grandma's b-day. We are going to go out and eat food (yay food!). Then of course we shall be venturing to my brother's baseball game. Go Westerhills Red!!! So, this past week I have been writing an email to Sam, telling him that I like him (THANK YOU KIM AND SAMANTHA FOR HELPING ME MOVE MY BUTT TO TALK TO HIM), but I never got around to sending it. The thing is I keep checking it for mistakes and stuff, plus I am really scared to tell him (I will be putting up the letter in here for only my friends to read). I was going to orginally going to email, because I didn't have his # to talk to him personally. But guess what happened today, he texted me. So now i have his # but i am too afraid to use it. i hope that I will actually be able to email him the letter. Please, God, give me strength. I have never felt so much fear in my life.

I can't believe this. I am taking another class. Why did I do this to myself? Well, at least I don't have to sit in a classroom for 5 hours straight. I am glad that I can do my work whenever I want (I am taking the class online and I have 6 months to finish it). Ho Hum, well, back to work.

So my weekend has gone well. I got to relax, a little. On friday night I spent the entire time with my friend. She has had some really bad stuff happen to her family, and she needed me. I spent almost all the night crying, eating ice cream, and helping her out. She is in a lot of pain right now. Oh well, all I can do is pray for her. The rest of the weekend was spent doing absolutely nothing. But oh well. Oh goodness, I started thinking about Sam. Am I ever going to get over my crush and move on. He's my friend, and I don't want to lose that friendship. But I can't help liking him. He is one of the only guys, who doesn't hate me. I mean sure, I have other guy friends but it isn't the same with him. He is like my best friend. Dang it, why does my life sound like one of those cheesy soap operas.

So yeah, the day has come, I am out of summer school! Yeah *does some random pose of excitement* But my teach came in late this morning to give us the final. In fact, she was an hour late. So what my class and I end up doing is "reviewing." Well it really wasn't much of a review, because of all the yelling and screaming in the class. The teach that reviewed us had no control over the class. I mean she yelled at some people, so she didn't get respect from any of the students. Oh well, I ended up putting down my head and nearly falling asleep. Then when my teach arrived. She took another 15 minutes to copy the test. Needless to say, it was a waste of time, but luckily the final only took 35 minutes to finish. I ended up watching some baseball game after the test, then I went home. What an exciting day in my life.

*dancing my little happy dance* One more day and summer school is over! Wow, I need to punch myself in the face. So, yeah today's summer school was one of those days that I didn't particularly enjoy. First, I had to take a quiz that I wasn't ready for, but luckily I actually pay attention in class so I think I passed. Then I had to present my alzheimer's disease project. O joy. It's not that the project isn't great, in fact it was awesome, (I am way to much of an overachiever, all of my class agrees. All I really needed to do is write a paper and show 1 or 2 pictures. Yet, I actually brought in a model of the brain to point out the places Alzheimer's affects; I brought in lots of pics and a video to get my point across.) but I hate speaking in front of people. Oh well, at least my class was astounded. Then I watched the baseball games going on in the field next to us. My friends were watching to, but they weren't watching the game if you catch my drift. It was indeed funny. At least my parents get back today.

Horray! The end of summer school is near. Thus i bounce for joy. bouncy bouncy bounce. Wow i am way to hyper, o well. So i have this ginormous paper to turn in tommorrow all about alzheimer's disease. o wait maybe that is one friday. o well. i think i have alzheimer's disease. Yeah! Lets go party. *voice in the background* You are an idiot. You use improper grammer, and you sound pathetic. In fact, you sound like you are on drugs. Have you sniff any white powder lately. *scarily happy voice* no, i am just high on life *voice in background beats the happy voice to a pulp* *silence* ahhhhhhh much better

god i wish i had more time to do this. it relieves so much stress. but anyway here comes the blather. i was in a wedding this weekend. yeah, maybe, it wasn't a big part of the wedding, but at least i was in it. the wedding was for my old baby-sitter and great friend amanda. i love her so dearly and when i saw her in the wedding dress, i was astounded. in fact i even started thinking of my own dress and my own wedding. wow, i have never done that before, which is surprising because half of my friends have there wedding picked out already. i hardly have figured out what i want my dress to look like. i want it similar to the dress below. either sleeveless or very thin straps, but sleeveless is preferred. i want the torso of the dress to be in a corset fashion, and i want the skirt to flare out. the dress below is one of the many dress that i would accept. wow i am a loser
Ahhh...Finals start on Tuesday. I'm really scared. Please God allow me to do well

Well last night I got confirmed into the church. It was a trilling experience, but the mass was really long. I am pround that I am confirmed, although I know in a couple of days there will be some bad acne on the place where the oil was.

TAKS are finally over. Let me put emphasis on the word FINALLY! Good God this week has been extremely boring. Do you not see this girls face she is so freakishly bored, and that is exactly how I felt. Well, at least I got started on my new story, but I don't know when I will start posting it. Maybe in the summer. If you want to read it go to quizilla.com. Anyways on to the rest of my day. I got to see some air force guys parchute in. They were supposed to give us the "don't do drugs talk," but then it started raining. We didn't do anything for the rest of the day. Thank God. And that is pretty much it.

Muhaha my first journal entry. omg *does a victory dance*. well, I don't really have anything to say right now except that I am glad the crappy taks math test is over. that was a waste of time. oh well off to go study for the social studies test. SCORE!!!
